intro: Stisseria sorroria, commonly known as the common stisseria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported diuretic properties. Stisseria sorroria is relatively easy to cultivate and serves as a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
